column5: The city of Dryden picked up just under 6 inches of rain on Friday morning. Many of the city streets are flooded and impassible. Here is the link: http://ckdr.net/news/1341361176/sudd...and-businesses
Here is a link to the video of Dryden's water problem. https://www.facebook.com/CKDR.Dryden...5418059173219/

I bet folks didn't have any choice words for the person that decided to pull into the entrance area of the hotel. Let's see.....we have a flood,so let's push a wall of water into the hotel through the front doors . The wing nut on the positive terminal must have been loose PjShorthorn.

In case you had Hwy 502 in your itinerary, you may need to detour. Hwy 594 at the north end of 502 is closed in both directions. This storm did more damage than first realized. Here is the link: http://www.mto.gov.on.ca/english/tra...ml#Event415137
Hwy 594 located at the north end of Hwy 502 has been reopened as of 9:50 AM. This includes both directions from the 502 junction.
We saw the rest of the day friday was going to be washed out and left a bit early, ended up driving through part of that rain on 594 / ojibway drive . it was quite a downpour.
